newsitem.title: UK: Sage has no plans for hostile Pegasus bid.
newsitem.headline: Sage has no plans for hostile Pegasus bid.

text.p: The Sage Group Plc said it regretted Pegasus Group Plc's decision to pull out of takeover talks and said it had no intention of making a hostile bid at present.
"Sage has no present intention of making an offer for Pegasus in the absence of a recommendation from the Pegasus board or a third party offer," Sage chairman David Goldman said in a statement.
"Sage believes that its proposal of 475 pence represented a very full valuation of Pegasus," the company said.
Accounting software firm Pegasus said on Wednesday that it had withdrawn from talks about an offer.
It said it felt the 475p per share offer undervalued its prospects and the benefits of a takeover to Sage.
It also felt the deal would be referred to competition authorities.
Pegasus shares were up 7-1/2p at 365p by 0933 GMT while Sage was trading at 473-1/2p, down 2-1/2p.
